abstract.p: Laporte PLC, British chemicals maker, will sell about 60 percent of its business to Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co for $1.2 billion in cash; Laporte also says its chief executive, Jim Leng, will succeed George Duncan, who is retiring, as chairman (S)

block.p: A British chemicals maker, Laporte P.L.C., said it would sell about 60 percent of its business to Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company, the United States buyout firm, for $1.2 billion in cash. The disposals are the latest in a line of restructuring efforts dating back to 1996, and will leave Laporte focused on its fine and performance chemicals business. Among the businesses being sold are pigments, additives, compounds, water technology, timber treatment and electronics, which had operating profit before exceptional items of $:83 million, or $120.7 million, last year, on sales of $:494 million. Laporte also said its chief executive, Jim Leng, would succeed George Duncan, who is retiring, as chairman.
